defaultEvents.description: What is the future of technology? AI? Death? Come join us for a seminar with the heads of Apple stationed in Hawaii.

Come meet us in the cafeteria for a chat and hackathon with the possibility to win a summer internship in Silicon Valley. Google is an American multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products, which include online advertising technologies, a search engine, cloud computing, software, and hardware.
Lets eat brunch and talk about electronics! Everyone who attends this event will receive a free brunch from Heavenly.

defaultProfiles.bio: Google is an American multinational technology company that specializes in Internet-related services and products, which include online advertising technologies, a search engine, cloud computing, software, and hardware.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: Samsung is a major manufacturer of electronic components such as lithium-ion batteries, semiconductors, image sensors, camera modules and displays for clients such as Apple, Sony, HTC and Nokia. It is the world's largest manufacturer of mobile phones and smartphones, started with the original Samsung Solstice and later, the popularity of its Samsung Galaxy line of devices.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company that specializes in consumer electronics, computer software and online services.
defaultProfiles.title: Company

defaultProfiles.bio: I like to paddle outrigger canoes.
In my spare time, I like to scuba dive.
Every summer, I enjoy visiting Portland, Oregon.
I escaped from Chicago and moved to Hawaii in 2014.
Most weekends, you can find me on my 8 foot dinghy.
defaultProfiles.title: Ph.D. (2020)

defaultProfiles.bio: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.
defaultProfiles.title: Student

defaultProfiles.bio: I am studying for a B.S. in Mathematics in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2021.
defaultProfiles.title: Student

defaultReports.description: The Browse Students and Browse Companies pages are not loading on my end. There may be an issue with the database. I know several others who've had similar issues. Please look into this.

There seems to be a problem loading user data on the Browse Companies and Browse Students pages. When I go to these pages, all I see is a loading icon that says 'getting data,' even after waiting five minutes.

I was attempting to log into Bridging the Gap last night, December 4th at 10:00pm, but the site was completely down. It works fine today, however. I'm not sure if maintenance was going on, but if not, it's something your team should look into.

I was testing the functionality of the site and came across something concerning. When I inserted a long description into my student profile, the height of the card increased dramatically. And when I went to the Browse Students page, every profile on the same row as my card became the same long height. I think there should be a limit put on the number of words you can have in your profile description.

I have a suggestion regarding the company homepage. Upon signing up, I tried adding a job listing but nothing happened when I clicked the button. It took me a while to realize that I had to click directly on the 'Add Job Listing' text to go and add a job listing. Is there a way you can change the ui so that you can simply click on the grey button surrounding the 'Add Job Listing' text to go to the link? And the same goes for the events page.

My team and I have noticed the range of locations to search by is very limited. Is there a way we could add our own categories? If not, is it possible you could add Canada, Dublin, London, Singapore, Hyderabad, Sydney, and Tokyo to the locations list? These are some of our global headquarters. Actually, it'd be best if there were more global locations in general for all the companies registered on this site.

While searching through students' profiles for potential job candidates, I came across a user by the name Jason Leigh (leighj@hawaii.edu). When I clicked the link to his portfolio page, I was sent somewhere unexpected and I think I may have downloaded a virus. Please look into the matter and contact us when you know more.
kylietompson@hawaii.edu has included vulgar content in her profile description.
app1e@app1e.com is masquerading as my company on the site. They are posting Apple events and creating fake job listings. Please take them down.
I came across the user bgray@gmail.com who has set an inappropriate image as his profile picture instead of a normal headshot.

The links to the events in the events page are not working. By links, I am referring to the title of the events, such as Apple's 'The Future of Technology conference,' which should redirect to the external event page, but does nothing when I click on it.

There are only 6 skill options to filter by in the Browse Students page, but students can type whatever skills they want in their profile. Can you add skill categories for filtering that match more of our skills?

The search categories for both companies and students is very limited and needs to be expanded upon. For instance, the skills we can search by for students is limited to people in computer science/the STEM field but it should be more inclusive.
Someone is pretending to be Apple. They're using the contact email app1e@app1e.com, and their job listings look like scams.
I am trying to submit my CV but when I click the link to do so (in the student homepage) nothing happens.

Not sure if this constitutes user abuse, but Walmart, Toyota, and FedEx have added a lot of job listings in the past hour, so it was a little frustrating looking through the job listings to find ones that match my computer-science interests. I think there should be a limit on how many job listings a company can add a day, or at least a way to filter job listings by what type they are.
I've noticed that bgray@gmail.com and kylietompson@hawaii.edu have inappropriate/vulgar content in their profiles. Also, bgray@gmail.com is one of the only users I've seen without a UH email.

This may have been an accident, I'm not sure, but Loren Parker has made multiple accounts on Bridging the Gap. In her first account, she uses the email 'lorenP@gmail.com' and in the second she uses 'lorenP@hawaii.edu'.

I added two events to the events page yesterday, but when I logged back in today. one of them seem to have disappeared. The event that disappeared was called 'Spend a day at the Google Headquarters'. Please look into this issue and contact us when you know what happened.

There is an issue with adding events. They seem to disappear after I create them in my homepage, which is unfortunate because our team has an event coming up in a week for college students. Please look into this problem as soon as possible.

defaultProjects.name: RadGrad
defaultProjects.description: Growing awesome computer scientists, one graduate at a time.

defaultProjects.name: WRENCH
defaultProjects.description: WRENCH is an open-source library for developing simulators for large-scale scientific computation

defaultProjects.name: Cyber Canoe
defaultProjects.description: Software for Unity projects involving stereoscopic resolution driven by 9 PCs with a GeForce 980 graphics card.
